isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL® VT 365 DIESEL ENGINE - POWER CYLINDERS - Removal - Piston Disassembly

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, mark the pistons with the cylinder number from which each was removed. If pistons will be reused, reinstall in correct cylinder bore.

To prevent engine damage, note the engine serial number (stamped on the crankcase pad, left side rear of the crankcase) and piston part number (stamped on the piston crown). Multiple pistons are available for service applications. Do not install pistons having different part numbers.
To prevent engine damage, mark pistons with the cylinder number from which each was removed. Each reused piston must be reinstalled into its original cylinder bore.

step1.para: Use Piston Ring Expansion Pliers to remove the piston rings. Remove top ring first, then intermediate ring, and finally oil control ring.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes.

step1.para: Separate connecting rod from piston as follows:

step2.para: Use pliers to remove both piston pin retaining rings.
Remove piston pin from its bore by hand, then separate connecting rod from piston.
